abstract.para: Installation of &peloton; should be straightforward on many platforms but there are always occasions when a manual install may be required. This document details installation procedures and the packages, libraries and applications upon which &peloton; depends.

sect2.title: Python libraries
sect2.para: The following pythonlibraries are either required always (R) or required when using particular modules (M) and must be installed either by installer scripts (distutils, Debian package etc) or by the system administrator.

listitem.para: RabbitMQ is a supported messaging backend. MQ servers need to be running in the &peloton; environment and these can be downloaded from the RabbitMQ site at . Packages are available for many platforms from the RabbitMQ site including Debian/Ubuntu and Windows - these include or will cause to be installed the Erlang language libraries.

Documentation for setting up RabbitMQ can be found on the site: in particular the instructions for clustering must be followed carefully - do not forget to copy the cookie to all hosts; without this hosts will not cluster together. More information about AMQP, its internals and security model can be obtained from the very readable specification located at .
Client-side libraries must also be installed - &peloton; has chosen to use the py-amqplib library obtained from and announced on this page.
